content.detailedDescription:
Report taken by phone by asd: 

i was leaving work at 18th and holmes and saw some orange lighs in the sky headed from west to east.  i was looking north at the time.  these were orange color orbs mving in an even trajectory and were moving past the top of and just above the buildings downtown.  one went in front of a building.  there was no noise and no flickering.  they appeared to be about 5 - 10 feet wide each. the objectes moved up gradually and went out of sight. 

the witness is sending a video.
content.summary: Several orange orbs pass downtown buildings in kc

content.detailedDescription:
i did a picture of a unknown aircraft. it's happen on  jun 24 2011 at 20.53 bulgarian time.I am living at the end fo the east part of dobrich (my place) and i saw it from the balcony of my flat.

my wife and my 7 year old son was witnesses.
 it was a glowing star-like  and not so fast moving object. noiseless and without air condense traces. 
an amasing object !
 i did optical zoom of my camera fujifilm s5500  in max (10x). 
the distance from me and this object was approximately 10 km and   3-4   km altitude, according my account.
 it float from north to south at east of dobrich.
i would like to send you the original picture and few with color filter manipulated !
when i did digital zoom  i saw  an jet aircraft in plasma cloud with two plasma streams, one from middle to down and one from middle to upper side  ! you'll see on the picture ...
i think this technology is very advanced, because it use too much energy to create plasma cloud ! probably a copy-paste from the aliens technology ...
just amasing !
just amasing !


 
best regards,

[name and email address removed/cms/tg]
content.summary: Probably a new technology aircraft

content.detailedDescription: I was walking out of a local retail store with my boys. we were looking at the moon and a jet that was coming in on flight path to a local airport. way above the commercial jet was a triangular shaped object that was heading in a straight line from west to east with a short contrail behind it probably 5 times the length of the object. i think it was a military plane but it was way to high and going way too fast than normal. my reaction was this is really odd because i have not seen commercial or military planes that high before.. maybe an sr-71 but those are retired. it looked like the shape of the space shuttle but i know that is not up there. it has yet to launch. i tried to take a picture with my cell phone camera but the object was too far up to get into the picture. the object continued east. no lights that i could see but it reflected white in front of the contrail. it was close to sunset so the sun rays were reflecting off the bottom of the object. it just continued east and eventually went out of sight into the distance. i would like to know if the faa would have tracked the object and would be able to tell me what it was.
content.summary: I believe it was military plane. what was odd was the object was way too high and going too fast to be a normal military craft.

content.detailedDescription: A friend of mine is claiming to see ufo���s weekly. so he started filming the sky. he took these pictures within a span of about a min and it shows (if you slide show them) that the entre sky moved. is this one big object? the trees did not move so the camera was not moving just the sky. something strange s going on so i sent it to you.
content.summary: Something strange going on in dalton ga

content.detailedDescription: Standing on porch in conway ar, facing north, saying goodbye to friends leaving the house. happened to look up and saw a reddish orange fireball with teardrop shape and tail that was headed south to north approx 10:03 or 4 pm central. immediately asked others to look at it and they saw same...I thought maybe fireworks? but it was way too high and lasted way too long. thought maybe flare, but was moving too fast to north...It got smaller and lost its tail as it got further north until it disappeared in the night sky like a star having appeared to never lose altitude or speed. came inside immediately and came here...
content.summary: Reddish orange fireball with teardrop shape headed south to north approx 10:03 central

content.detailedDescription: At sunset i was in an open area near my house taking pictures of the crescent moon against the setting sun to test my camera settings.  the fireworks were to the north, 3 spherical orange/pink objects suddenly appeared in the western horizon at approx 35 degrees and i thought it was fireworks but they didn't explode but continued to travel east while ascending until they were directly overhead of me and grew further apart with several others following in primarily a straight line, too stunned to get a picture, i ran home to get my daughter and nephew as i couldn't believe what i was seeing. we watched as they grew fainter as they reached the 90 degree point and disappeared.  my daughter was able to get 2 pictures after they had started to separate and more glowing white rather than in the original color so perhaps the setting sun influenced their initial color.  of course my camera battery died. we all got very little sleep that night and i'm still stunned.  there were so many of them i don't understand why there wasn't some sort of media coverage.  and no, it wasn't chinese lanterns, they moved too rapidly and in formation.
content.summary: 3 in triangle at first then spread others about a dozen followed

content.detailedDescription:
So i am a video editor.  occasionally i have to do renders on projects which takes anywhere from 5 min to 1hr depending on how big the project is. normally during this time i like to walk around outside and smoke a cig to let time pass.  last night, i walked around as usual.  kinda warm night with very scattered low clouds.  i notice on my way back to the apartment, a bright light in the sky behind me. i think nothing of it cause ive seen helicopters and planes around here all the time. then i notice it gets really bright and at this time i notice its not making any noise.  it dims again, so i naturally think a cloud covered it. so i wait for the cloud to pass to see if i can get another look at it. it gets really bright again.  still not moving in the sky, it gets dim again.  so i start counting in my head about how long before it would get bright again. it was about 10 seconds. so i waited and saw if it would do it again around the same time. and it did. it was like someone turning a dimmer switch to max very slowly every 10-12 seconds. i quickly ran back to the apartment, woke my girlfriend up and had her accompany me to the balcony where she was able to see it for herself. she could clearly confirm that it was like nothing she has ever seen before. and she used to live close to miramar afb. so she has seen alot of aircraft, and i could take her word for it if she said she hasnt seen something similar to this.


 after not moving for a while, it started to drift toward the 5 hwy, while maintaining the same altitude and same rhythmic pattern of brightness.  i asked my gf if she could describe the shape of the light while i was lookin for memory cards to put into my camera.  she said it was "starry" shaped.  when i initially saw it, i would say the light was shaped kinda like the atari logo, but i do not believe the device the light was coming from itself was. i would guess it was round but not much bigger than the shape of the light.  as if the light took up most of the area at the bottom.  i called the police but they showed up an hour later after it was long gone. 

while watching it, i was tryin to get my canon rebel t3 to record video but apparently my sd card's class doesnt allow a fast enough write buffer for this dslr to record video to.  so i had to use a kodak zi8 point-n-shoot camera.  so the quality is not the best but.   i do put my hands in front of the camera so there is point of reference that i am not zooming in to cause "aperture adjustments".    
as we are watching it, i started to punch all the holes in this thing as i could as to what it could be. 
too slow to be a backscatter xray drone. or any other rear propelled uav.
it wasnt a star. considering 2 things, it was moving away from the earth's rotation relative to where the other stars were visable, and this kodak doesnt have the light sensor to even view the northstar.
the stationary rhythmic lights would rule out a flare.  i even suggested that it would be a chain of flares set to light in sequential order, but the lights were blue/white. unless yu magnesium flares are within the consumer bracket now, it should be reddish if they were flares cause of the sulfur right? not to mention the lighting would have to be timed perfectly.
we speculated it could be a hobbyist project or one of those toy ufos.  it flew across the entire skyline well out of the range of radio control. and the brilliance of the light looks like it would be quite out of the range of most consumers' budgets.  i really do wish more people could have seen how bright it was. 

those are really the two things about this sighting i cannot wrap my mind around. how it was just able to stand still then drift slowly without making any noise.  and how it was able to project such a bright light.

normally with lights, the brightest part is usually visible when its directly pointed at you. this thing seemed to have that effect despite what angle it was at while flying over.  as if the light was focused on all points instead of one.

after it flew away out of view (continuing its consistent light behavior) i stood outside for the rest of the night wondering what it was, what it wasnt, and if anyone cared.  i called the police when it first showed up because when it was stationary and pulsating, i didnt know if it was something about to hit the ground or what.  
i am not a fan of false reporting but i cant help but wonder if i reported something else more severe to get them out there quicker would have been overlooked once they saw what we saw.  i would have been willing to risk it and will risk it in the future just to get a more authoritative witness to this. they were kinda dismissive and skeptical as i would have been 2 hours prior. 

i wish i could show you more and explain more. but really like most others, you had to be there.   i will promise everyone this though,  i will start investing my money in more night-friendly camera equipment.  i dont care how much it takes.  this changed my life and my whole view on things. 

thank you for your time.  the videos i include are directly from the camera's memory card.  no tampering has been done in anyway.
content.summary: Small object with rhythmic bright light.

content.detailedDescription: While talking on a cellphone on my patio i observed 2 orbs about the size of a pencil eraser held at arms length that appeared to stay at a constant distance apart (about the distance of two fingers held an inch apart at arms length).  they were observed at an altitude that ranged from my neighbor's rooftop (about 10 degrees) to about 30 degrees in the ssw sky from queen creek, az.  i had no reference to judge distance to the objects, but with my naked eye i would guess between 3-10 miles.  the orbs moved fairly slowly at times back and forth, and up and down, and would occasionally twirl around one another before returning to a back and forth or up and down movement, then after a minute or two they would drop below my view blocked by my neighbor's rooftop.  then a couple of minutes later they would rise above my neighbor's rooftop and again go through similar maneuvers.  the objects were a very bright pure white light that maintained the apparent same intensity at all times they were viewed.  i only viewed the objects twice between 11:00pm to 11:15pm from my patio.  i looked for them several other times but never saw them again.  at first i assumed the objects were fireworks from the 4th of july, or airplane landing lights; but neither fireworks nor landing lights could perform the maneuvers of the objects.  at no time did i hear any type of noise coming from the objects, and there was no trailing tail of light as they moved.  also, the objects appeared to move in a straight line when they moved, then stop for a moment, and then move in a straight line in a different direction.  the exception was when they would occasionally spin around one another, but even while spinning they appeared to move in a straight line.
content.summary: 2 round orbs equal distance apart moving together in all different directions.

content.detailedDescription:
Late in the evening during the annual 4th of july holiday fireworks i was standing in my back yard when i noticed a bright orange ball moving through the night sky.  this caught my attention immediately because it matched another ufo sighting i had just a few months earlier.

the object moved quickly and silently.  it appeared beyond the diminishing fireworks going off around the city and had two noticeable features - the orange glow grew and decreased in brightness in a way that made it appear to flicker, and its movement was non-ballistic in that it seemed to jerk forward sometimes pausing and then continuing on.  

the night sky was perfectly clear.  it was easy to discern that the orange ball had no red or green conventional aircraft lights.  also, the bright orange light which at first seemed to be coming toward my general location was equally bright when it gradually turned to the south and eventually first faded and then vanished from sight as it appeared to move south roughly following the path of interstate 5.

the luminosity of the orange glow was far brighter than any star or planet visible at that hour.  the magnitude of the object was perhaps 7 to 10 times larger than any other object in the night sky.

several minutes after the object had disappeared, my girl friend came outside and i mentioned the sighting to her just minutes before another bright orange ufo appeared to the east of eugene.  we watched it approach from the east and then like the fist object, it eventually turned to the south with a similar jerky and sometimes brighter, sometimes dimmer appearance.

over the next 30 minutes we watched as another three individual orange ufos appeared in the east and made their way one by one curving eventually to the south and fading strangely from sight.

i mentioned that late in 2010 i had seen another orange ufo from my back yard in eugene.  that sighting lasted only about 30 seconds but the object appeared to be directly over head and at much closer range.  i was able to get a good look at the orange ball through moderately powerful binoculars which i had been using to star gaze with.  it was moving from north to south silently and appeared to be about as large as the full moon, so it was quite large.  i could not determine the altitude, but it seemed to be several hundred yards above me.  my magnified look at the orange ball revealed it seemed to be a translucent glowing ball which may have contained an object inside.  the surface of the orange sphere seemed to flow with a liquid consistency and was very dynamic.  i speculated it might be some kind of high energy plasma field surrounding another object.  the object disappeared abruptly by fading from sight.

i was in the u.S. air force and am accustomed to working flight lines in many parts of the world observing all kinds of sophisticated air craft at night, but seeing these orange ufos from different perspectives, flight paths, dates, times, and with another witness convinced me that i should report the event.  i did not notice other reports about the july 4th sighting in the media, but at that late hour and after so many other holiday fireworks, this did not surprise me.
content.summary: Multiple bright orange ufo's appear and follow similar path to the south of eugene

content.detailedDescription:
Was at the pool with my children, happened to look up to the southeastern sky, and saw what appeared to be an airplane or helicopter - but was a bright green, with no other identifying lights. as the object came closer overhead, there was no noticable sound, and clearly no other lights as a plane or helicopter would have. this object moved south to north, slowly, and eminated the same color green light the entire time. no flashing, no radiating, just green. my two children 7 and 4, both saw the same thing, the older of the two asked me what the light was. i had no explanation.
it took roughly 3 minutes for the object to travel out of view.
content.summary: Green light

content.detailedDescription:
Large stationary red square light hovered over the house next door. i was already outside for awhile busy watering flowers and vegetables while watching the sky for all the fireworks all around. i did not see this light earlier and it took me by surprise. at first, i thought it was a huge firework that was ready to explode but it did not. then i thought maybe it could be airplane but it did not move for awhile and did not have any blinkers or flashing faa lights. it made no noise. this object was very low and as it just hovered there a small plane did fly by. the object was from my vantage point as large trash totter. it just hovered and slowly then dissolved into a tiny faint transparent ball that moved across the yards in a straight line and just sat in the sky across the yard until it disappeared.

a couple of minutes later i sat down facing west and i saw while there was fireworks and airline traffic in the skies what looked like smooth round balls of  very red/orange lights coming up from the horizon and flowing up together in unison around the cresent moon. the moon was orange at that time. there were several of these and it went on for a couple of minutes. they did not explode or anything. they seemed following eachother and to be dancing and then they would slowly just disappear and then others would follow. these objects must have been large because these were out in the distance but very defined.
content.summary: L:arge red light hovers over neighbors house followed by red orange spheres

content.detailedDescription: About 10 pm, my grandfather and i (witnesses b and a, respectively on audio recording of interview) witnessed 2 cases or possibly 3 of obols during the july 4th fireworks display. i video'd the event, and made a dvd for the field investigator that visited my house to conduct an interview. the orange light appeared behind the fireworks and proceeded to pass over the car. i did have it on video. the second time, the orb came over and my attention was drawn to it by a 4th witness, passing the car. i proceeded to get out of the car, and used my phone's camera to record the object until it left view. i perceived it to be a light the could be flaming.
content.summary: During fireworks show orange orb appears and proceed to fade out

content.detailedDescription: I don't want to type out my experience i'd rather just share it with an investigator over the phone its very personal situation and the both of us just would really be happy with talking to someone first thanks.
content.summary: Approached us, time loss...Physical marks

content.detailedDescription:
First event: the night was very clear with no wind. my area was very dark and allowed for excellent visibility. a sphere orange in color (glowing) moved directly from the north across the sky to disappear behind the mt due southeast. it was very low and dropped down behind trees on the southern mt.  it was between 200 - 500 ft above my house.  everything was completely silent and moved at a slow steady pace.  it was so quiet that i did not hear dogs, frogs or any other sounds.  the entire event could have lasted between 5-7 minutes. (possibly a few minutes longer) 

within a few moments possibly (10 minutes)a large cylindrical shape moved low over the sky from east to direct west.  the shape was orange but we could see underneath there were red glowing lights (3 or 4) in a straight line on the belly of the craft.  the lights were steady and glowing. it also appeared to have an angular shape when we watched it disappear...Possibly triangular. the event only lasted a few moments (2-4 minutes) because there is a hill directly west and the object disappeared behind it.  again there was complete silence no craft noise, and no noises at all.
content.summary: at 10:15 pm moving from direct north to southeast (lower than planes) a large yellow orange ball moved silently across the sky.

content.detailedDescription:
Three of us were on a sailboat in the albemarle sound (north carolina) in route from manteo (departed near 9:45 a.M.) to coinjock (nnw). we were motoring at 7.5 nautical miles per hour & had passed kitty hawk to the east at 10:50 a.M. on july 1, 2011. i believe that we were southeast of the mouth of the pasquotank river.

we were constantly scanning the water watching for crab pots, debris, sailing markers, etc and hoping to see dolphins. around noon i saw in the distance (nnw, 3-5 miles) a very large white shape, rectangular with rounded ends. it was so pale it blended with the skies & water but was distinct from the nearby trees. there was some smoke from the peat fires to the east so the view was not the best. 

i studied the sight with binoculars & didn't have a clue about what i was seeing. i pointed it out to the other sailors who also looked and had a similar reaction. we could not determine if the object was hovering, floating, teetered or otherwise secured. it did not seem to move.

i took two pictures though it was very hard to see the object in the lens. i zoomed out (shutter speed 1/1250; focal length 60.0 mm) in the direction i was looking & clicked twice. remember, we were on a boat so holding a camera steady is a challenge! the first picture shows the complete object that we estimated was over 200 feet tall and 1000 feet long. the second picture shows the object partially hidden by trees. (the object was not moving; our boat was taking us out of sight of it as we continued our trip.) look closely in the trees to the right & see a house to get perspective of the size. 

we wondered if it was a blimp since we had seen a blimp and blimp hangar on june 21 when we were leaving elizabeth city. but, it was much larger and a different shape from any blimp we could recall. the bulges on either end of the object and the lack of "fins" plus the sheer size of it made us doubt that possibility. also, there were dark squares that appeared to be windows near the mid-line along the right side of the object.

at the time we were wondering what it was, trying to figure it out, knowing we had never seen anything like it. we were curious but assumed there was a logical explanation. we chose not to investigate further as we were meeting friends and wanted to get to port before any afternoon showers might appear.
content.summary: White cigar-shaped with bulges near ends object, taller than trees & 4-5 times longer, maybe 250' x 1000'

content.detailedDescription:
I was having a day at the lake with my family and all the girls decided to take out the pontoon boat out for a ride .. we were riding around on the lake looking at all the lovely homes we stoped the boat to see something that showed up on the fish finder and we fished for a bit .. i was sitting in the back of the boat and admireing the moon which looked full and was in the sky in the middle of the afternoon then all the sudden i wittnessed a bright light in the sky to the left of the moon it looked very high in the shy and looked small because of the distance .. it was moving very fast to the other side of the moon and then comeing back .. it moved so fast before i could blink my eye .. it would do this same thing four or five different times , each time it would just disapear and return .. i was the only one on the boat that could see this ... i was asking the other girls if they could see it because it was so exciting to me but the other girls kept talking and teased  me and said do you need some help honey and laughing at me .. i know what i saw and will never forget it .. i want to know what it was .. i was not able to get any pictures at the time because i left my phone on shore so it would not get wet .. i wish i had some photos to share maybe then someone would believe me .. left here wondering !!

thanks 
(name removed)fg
content.summary: Strange lights in sky over lake murray.

content.detailedDescription: Me and my mom witnessed a ufo last night,,in melbourne florida . it was the shape of a octagon , flew over the house very slow,, ran in and got my mom she is still excited about it,, it was black or dark greyish  and had a red light under neath that changed shape from a circle to strobe then diamond , i watched it thru the birnoculars for about 10 minutes as it headed west, after it was gone i looked to see if anybody else had reported it,, but nothing on any of the news sites,, it was travelling from east to west headed towards the st. cloud kissimmee area in florida . we watched the object from our drive way it traveled directly over our property, at first i believed it to be a stealth fighter,, but after seeing it thru the birnoculars i realized it was octagon shaped. eventually it just vanished from site.
content.summary: Octagon shape with a red light on the bottom, that changed shape.

content.detailedDescription: There where two, the first one looked like a normal air craft,but it was on fire until it slowed down to a slow western path.Then it turn to a giant black oval shape, the best i can say is black water ballons thay seem to move as if thay where fill with water? and then both took the same path to the west. now when i look at them though my 4/30 bushnells,stright above my location i must say i'v never seen anything like this before. it actuly scared me!
content.summary: It came in off the south atlantic ocean over the port st lucie nuclear plant>

content.detailedDescription: I was outside, and saw this object. i grabbed my camcorder and taped it. i have a sony dvd camcorder that uses a 3 inch disc.  all the time i leaned against a door frame to tape this object. i used the zoom, it is 24 power. i live near the atlanta air port. i see jets all day and night long. there is a flight path that goes over my place. the time of duration was about 2 minutes. i watched the object go out of sight. it went from west to east. the weather condition was clear, there were no obstructions preventing me from taping the thing. i see planes all the time, some are high altitude and have a trail. it is not too difficult to see a plane ahead of the trail. but as you will see, this object had no plane ahead of its contrail. i knew as soon as i saw this thing that it was not normal. it made no sudden turns, or anything, it just went over and out of sight.The event is in two segments. i stopped temporarily to get my tripod, but elected to simply lean against a door frame for steady footage. i sent this report to a friend who has a ufo investigation group, but the investigation was very lacking. i had to wait months to get back my disc of the event. this was due to the administrator's unprofessional demeanor.
content.summary: I taped this object going over my place

content.detailedDescription:
The object was observed from a forest preserve at (location removed placed below) with an elevation of 836 feet above sea level as indicated by the google earth program.  [please do not call the forest preserve district as they might end the observing privileges of the amateur astronomy club that was there that evening]

the object was visible in the ne sky about 15 degrees above the horizon (+/- 5 deg.) and was first noticed at an azimuth of about 20 degrees (nne).  it disappeared into haze at an azimuth of about 45 degrees (ne).  no noise came from the object and it appeared to be self illuminated.  direction of travel was from west to east at a constant height above ground.  additional information:

- steady point light source; brightness about same for entire event; not a firefly.  same brightness as bright satellite but not quite as bright as international space station (iss) or an iridium flare.
- no meteor tail or streak
- angular size estimated at less than 0.5 degrees of arc.
- no airplane navigation or landing lights
- distance to object not known, but could have been near i-88 or state route 38 (lincoln highway).
- international space station tracking and location was checked.  this object was not the iss.
- brightness was too steady to be an iridium flare

my reaction to this sighting is that it could have been a probe device (no occupant) which have been seen in the area before, such as near marengo, il.  common objects fitting the above description must be fairly limited in number.  if the object was near the above mentioned highways at a distance of something like 6 miles its speed could have been in excess of 2000 miles per hour.

no photos were taken.

other individuals present did not notice the object and were preoccupied with hobby concerns.
content.summary: A fast moving object was seen from an amateur astronomy observing site.  it covered about 25 degrees of arc horizontally in 5 seconds.

content.detailedDescription: We saw what looked like headlights in the sky a long ways off and we thought nothing of it kept on talking joking about how it looked like the flubber car from the robin williams movie we kind of forgot about it and kept talking we looked up and noticed it was problably 100 or so feet away and coming straight at us very slowly we were in shock we couldn't believe what we were seeing it flew right over top of us it was about 25 feet long and half that wide it was a hexagon shape it was going about 5mph if that i could of walked faster than it was going it made a quiet humming sound and had what looked like headlights same color and everything and there were red lights on all 6 points of the hexagon they didn't blink nothing on it blinked we could make out angles of the object it reminded me of how a stealth bomber looks real sharp angles on the sides of the object it was a dark color it looked black it was just over the top of the trees i could of hit it with a rock my friend was going to shine a flashlight at it i smacked it out of his hand there is a little more detail but nothing to speak of i reported this some time ago to the indiana mufon network and spoke to someone from there and he acted like i was making it up and told me ufos are usually cigar shaped disc shaped etc. i told him to think of these ufo shapes as different makes and models of cars he laughed i'm reporting it again with the hopes that someone from the site can contact me about this this is the most shocking thing i have seen but just a fraction of what i unfortunately have witnessed i make any ufo special look boring and i am trying to understand why
content.summary: Ufo flew about 60 ft above me and a friend

content.detailedDescription: 20 or so glowing golden orb-like lights traveling from west to east turning south and fading in the distance. local fireworks were winding down. i was in the front yard by the street talking to a neighbor. i saw these very bright lights coming from the west through the trees. they were even brighter than say the iss when it is coming up over the horizon. the lights(orbs?), were randomly spaced apart it would seem,(see video). they would continue heading east for a couple of minutes, traveling very slowly, and then they would seem to turn and head south till they faded from view. the video is pretty poor, the turning and heading south is not picked up on the video. someone in southern cal., also posted a very similar event that occurred at the exact time, 350 miles away. the objects i saw were approx. 8-10 degrees above the horizon only. if the objects that i saw are the same objects videoed in carson cal., i believe that would mean that they were "very" high. but i don't know.
content.summary: 20 or so glowing golden orb-like lights traveling from west to east turning south and fading in the distance.

content.detailedDescription:
Here are two photo collages and photos my husband took on july 4th from the balkony of our home . i asked him to take some pics of the fireworks (since he likes astronomy he is skilled at taking photos of the sky) and when he did so he forgot to change it to 100 sensitivity (which would have made the fire works come out nicer and clear, but washed out the ufos) and instead took them at 800 (which allowed the ufos to show up, we did not see them directly, with our naked eyes). we think that they could not be remnants of the fireworks, or some kind of military aircraft etc and this is because of the way they behaved. one time they hovered (no movement) for over 30 seconds) they also seemed to appear and disappear in and out of some kind of vortex/hole/opening, which can be faintly seen on the photos. the reason we know they did not move but hovered at some point is due to no change between photos (one minute inbetween shudder  and camera was fixed in same spot on balcony rail) and you can (faintly though) see an airplane passing by below (which in comparison of course did move.
0 the ufos appeared and disappeared within about 5 minutes.
blessings!
content.summary: Ufo sighting over colorado springs july 4th 2011

content.detailedDescription: I was mikes friendly cab station, on the north side of kokomo, looking to the southwest, about to get into my cab.  (i drive a cab for a living) i saw a large, orange ball of light in the sky at about 40 degrees from horizon. it would take a quarter at arms length to cover it.  it hovered in the same place for about 60 seconds, flared up and got brighter for a second or two, s and then dimmed in and out for a couple seconds. it did this a few times. the final time it started to get brighter, it began to move and suddenly then shot really fast to the east.  i watched it until it was out of my sight.
content.summary: Large orange ball of light

content.detailedDescription:
My husband and i just returned after watching fireworks, and was admiring the neighbor's display when a bright orange/red fireball caught my eye. it was due east in the sky above the tree line. it looked like 5 of the brightest stars you would see in the sky combined. we really didn't know what to think.
it remained stationary and got brighter, the began to slowly fade, like it was slowly turning around (180) while stationary. 
my husband joked (who has never seen any lights before while i have) and said "there's your ufo" and began heading toward the door which is west.
he then froze and said "would you look at that!" in the nw sky were four more orange lights exactly like the one due east.  the four were the same brightness and color, but momentarily got bigger as if they were getting closer.  my husband went into the house (i think he was scared) and i continued to watch...They stopped getting bigger and began fading.  but as i noticed they were fading not because of turning around like the due east on but the were ascending straight up and were getting dimmer because of their ascent. 
everything took about a minute.
content.summary: Reddish/orange stationary light balls

content.detailedDescription:
Witness one: on friday evening, may 21, 2004, i was watching television in bed. at approximately 10:30 pm, an electrical storm began to develop.

i was beginning to get sleepy and was considering turning the television off and going to sleep. when there were two very rare bursts of static on the television about a minute apart (both at 10:42, according to my tivo clock), my decision to go to sleep was made since i also feared that it might not be safe to leave the television on any longer. i pressed the "record" button on my tivo so that i could finish watching the program at another time, very likely made a quick trip to the bathroom (though i'm not sure), took off my glasses (i'm very near sighted), and got back into bed.

i lay down on my left side facing the large panoramic windows in my bedroom. even with my very impaired vision, i immediately became aware of some lights moving in the sky in a way i'd never seen before. i immediately sat up, retrieved my glasses from the night table, and put them on. outside my window and over rock creek park and a large residential building across the street, balls of light were moving rapidly and a bit jerkily in an oval-shaped counterclockwise pattern.

it's difficult to say exactly how many there were, but i believe that four individual lights would be a good estimate. after watching them for a stunned minute or two, i got out of bed, and went next door to get my sister. together we stood at the window and watched this light show for approximately five minutes. towards the end, the lights seemed to simply fade away through the heavy cloud cover until there was only one left. that light eventually faded as well. i did not look at the clock again until after my sister left. the time was 10:58.

though i've called them "balls" of light, they weren't perfectly spherical. there was no hard edge to them, though i do believe there was a brighter intensity at the center of each. during the entire event, they kept moving in the same circular pattern ��� very, very rapidly and very, very erratically, though pinpointing precisely where they were is tough, i recall that my sister and i both stooped a bit to get a full view of the "show". (i usually have the blinds in my bedroom about 1/3 of the way down.) i forgot until saturday evening when i turned on my television and my tivo that i had recorded during the exact time of the event. because i'm very sure that it was the second burst of static that caused me to turn off the television, i can time the start of the event (using the tivo clock) at precisely 10:42.

in retrospect, the static on the television is very interesting. our cable service is very reliable here and is not affected by the weather at all. neither my sister nor i can ever recall seeing bursts of static since we've had this service (more than four years) and they are dramatic. both are preserved on my tivo.


witness two: on the evening of friday, 5/21/04 i was in my bedroom reading. a very powerful thunderstorm had been right over our building for approximately ten minutes when my sister came into my room and asked me to come look at something. i glanced at the clock and noted that it was 10:46pm. she asked me to look out the window in her bedroom at the sky over rock creek park. i saw at different times 1, 2, 3, or 4 blurry, yet distinct white lights moving counterclockwise in an apparent oval shaped orbit. the cloud cover was heavy, but my perception was that the lights were within or circling one particular cloud. the lightning was intense and lit up the entire sky several times as we watched the lights. the lights moved constantly in an erratic, jerky fashion, seemingly unaffected by the lightning. their movement appeared ghostly to me and i thought of casper cartoons. their shape is harder to describe. narrow at the bottom and wider at the top is close ��� almost torch-like with indistinct edges. it was my impression that their blurry, undefined appearance was due to the cloud cover and extremely hazy skies. after about ten minutes the intensity of brightness dimmed and i realized that only one light was still visible as it gradually disappeared. the storm raged on for another few minutes. my sister and i talked for a minute or two and i went back to my room at approximately 11:00pm.
content.summary: Fireballs over washington, dc

content.detailedDescription: My mother's friend marsha and i were sitting on my family's pontoon boat that was docked on our pier in front of our cottage on hudson lake, which is located in northwest indiana.  we were sitting out there for about 15 minutes watching the fireworks, as it was july 3rd and fireworks of all shapes & sizes were going off around the lake & in nearby towns - all of which are visible from the water.  then out of the corner of my eye i spotted a very odd looking object coming in slowly from the west.  i noticed it because even from far away it looked like a ball of fire floating in the sky.  marsha completely agreed that it was not fireworks (and no, we were not drinking).  we just sat there and watched it slowly move closer and closer, until finally it was hovering directly over the middle of hudson lake.  it hovered there for about a minute.  as it got closer, it appeared to be more rectangle in shape and the inside of it gave off a brilliant red flame-like glow, while the outer edge appeared to be grey.  it had no propellers & no wings, in fact, it had no appendages at all.  after the object hovered for a minute, it made a complete right turn and headed south...Slowly at first, but then after about 30 seconds it sped way up, and poof it was gone.  both marsha & i knew without question that it was a ufo.  i knew it from the second i laid eyes on it...I mean, i look at the sky all the time & in my 38 years had never seen anything even remotely close to it.  marsha is much older me, and she too said that she'd never seen anything like it & completely agreed with me in my assessment.  the whole time we were watching it, we just kept saying to each other, can you believe what we are seeing?!?!  my mother then came down to the boat & we explained to her that we had just seen a ufo.  she brushed us off, said we were crazy...That it had to have been fireworks.  i assured her that fireworks don't travel horizontally slowly for miles & then hover in one spot & then make 45 degree turns & continue traveling in another direction.  strange thing though, about an hour later - when both marsha & i were no longer around - my mother and aunt donna said they saw the exact same thing from our deck (which overlooks our pier & hudson lake).  however, they said the object came in from the south (which is the last direction marsha and i saw it traveling).  they said it came in slowly, and that it then hovered over the middle of the lake.  however, this time it appeared to be a green ball of fire, not red.  they said that after about a minute of hovering, a smaller oval looking ball of green fire descended from it, and when it did, there appeared to be yellow rope-like strings attached to it from the main object.  they said the smaller object hovered for a moment below the larger one, and then plunged very fast into the lake & disappeared.  the main larger green fire-like object then turned left and headed back out west towards laporte, in.  both said they have absolutely no idea what it is that they saw...Nor are they able to explain it or make any sense of it.  and i told them, "hence the term ufo."  also, i asked our lawn boy (john k.) when he came by this morning if he happened to see anything strange in the sky the night of july 3rd.  he said, yes, in fact he did.  he was watching the fireworks with a friend that night from hudson lake's public beach, and he said they both noticed what looked to be a bright moving fireball in the sky...But then they lost sight of it, and just started watching the fireworks again.  he said they weren't sure what it was.
content.flightPath: Hovering then path,Path with directional change,Path then hovering
content.shape: Circle,   Cylinder,   Fireball,   Oval,   Sphere,   Square,   Rectagular,   Other,   Unknown
content.summary: Oval shaped fire like object came in slowly from the west, then hovered over hudson lake for a minute, before turning 45 degrees & heading south.

content.detailedDescription: Cnn coverage of arizona dust storm this morning, saw two obvious ufo's in footage.  found the whole video on youtube this afternoon at [link moved to additional evidence section/cms/tg].  news people don't mention a thing about them!
content.summary: Ufos on cnn dust storm video

content.detailedDescription:
Beginning the end of the month of july of 2010, my wife & i were sitting on our front porch at approximately 10:00pm.  approaching from the south and moving in a northerly direction was a bright yellowish orange light surrounded by a bright orange halo, undetermined speed and altitude.  we stepped to the front yard and watched it approach.  it passed directly overhead and began to slowly fade in intensity until it vanished from sight directly overhead.  there was no sound or any other disturbance.  
then comes july the 2nd of this year.  while watching the annual lake fireworks display again the same object approached from the south heading due north at a relatively slow speed (fireworks were booming all over the place) but impossible to determine velocity and altitude. position hard to determine but appeared to be approximately 1.5 to 2 miles due east of the fireworks display.  continued north and began to slowly fade until it disappeared.  
the seven which were sighted came through on the same heading and apparent altitude, velocity and position relative to the fireworks display at approximately 5 to 7 minute intervals.  the first four headed due north and disappeared (the first of these faded out)the fifth object stopped and remained stationary for a period of approx. 2 to 3 minutes, then changed course to a heading of due east and continued on that course until out of sight.  two more objects appeared under the same conditions both of which again changed course from a northerly heading to due east.  both of those objects continued until out of sight.
july the 3rd at 10:30pm my wife and i were sitting on our front porch watching a large fire works display put on by a group of neighbors when in ten minute intervals 3 objects appeared on the same course heading, apparent attitude and velocity.  i observed them through binoculars and noted bright orange core surrounded by an orange aura again with no sound.  these three objects then changed course from due north to due east and continued in sight for approximately 5 min until out of sight.
i am a retired engineer and have been a pilot for 34 years.
content.flightPath: Straight-line path,Path with directional change,Path then hovering
content.summary: Observed a total of 7 sphere like objects (with halo around them) at 4th july event
